supplyCode: For reporting of invoices subject to reverse charge
supplyCode.1a: 1a – Gold – intermediary supply of investment gold
supplyCode.3: 3 – Supply of immovable property, if VAT is applied to such supply (fulfillment according to § 92d)
supplyCode.3a: 3a – Supply of immovable property in compulsory auction
supplyCode.4: 4 – Provision of construction or assembly work (fulfillment according to § 92e)
supplyCode.4a: 4a – Construction and assembly work – provision of workers
supplyCode.5: 5 – Goods listed in Annex No. 5 to the VAT Act (fulfillment according to § 92c)
supplyCode.6: 6 – Supply of goods originally provided as a guarantee
supplyCode.7: 7 – Supply of goods after transfer of reservation of ownership
supplyCode.11: 11 – Transfer of allowances for greenhouse gas emissions
supplyCode.15: 15 – Integrated circuits and printed circuit boards
supplyCode.16: 16 – Portable devices for automated data processing (e.g. tablets or laptops)
supplyCode.19: 19 – Supply of electricity through systems or networks to a trader
supplyCode.20: 20 – Supply of gas through systems or networks to a trader
supplyCode.21: 21 – Provision of defined electronic communication services

tooltips.number: A unique identifier used to identify the issued document
tooltips.paymentMethod: The method by which the invoice will be paid (e.g. bank transfer, cash, credit card, etc.)
tooltips.dateInvoiced: The date on which the invoice was issued
tooltips.dueDate: The date by which the invoice must be paid
tooltips.constantSymbol: A unique identifier of the subject in a given payment system. The maximum length is 10 characters.
tooltips.duzp: The date on which the taxable service or sale for which the invoice was issued was performed.
tooltips.variableSymbol: A variable symbol is used to identify the invoice in the banking system. The maximum length is 10 characters.
tooltips.invoice: Used to identify the original invoice that you are correcting with this corrective tax document.
